item.description:
NEW HAMPSHIRE SERIES:
Mt. Tecumseh

EVENT ORGANIZER: Julie Moran. Please contact me here with your thoughts and ideas about this trip: jmmoran {{AT}} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882. FINISH YOUR NH 48 4,000 LIST WITH US!


ESSENTIAL TRIP DETAILS:

When / Where: See above.

Difficulty: 5.0 miles, 2,150 Feet total vertical climb. At a 1.5 mile / hour pace this is about a 3 1/4-hour hike.

CLICK HERE: Google Maps Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from the Dolly Copp Camping area (where our combined groups will be camping during the weekend) to the trailhead location at the Waterville Valley parking lot (parking is free), Waterville Valley, NH.


Mt Tecumseh as seen from the Tripyramids..



TRIP SUMMARY / UPDATES (05/10/2010 9 a.m.): This trip is a cross-posted weekend camping event with Hudson Valley Hikers (HVH), Hiking Mates CHALLENGE (HMC) and the 4 Seasons Hiking Group, tied to the Memorial Day weekend joint hiking event -- we're going to try to get one last 4,000-footer before heading home ... pray for great weather!

The Mount Tecumseh Trail leads from the Mount Tecumseh ski area in Waterville Valley over the summit of Mount Tecumseh to Tripoli Road. Mount Tecumseh is one of the easiest 4000-footers to hike up, and unless you bushwhack you will use at least part of this trail to get there. Most hikers go up and back from the ski area. Tecumseh was a Shawnee chief from what is now Ohio who was killed fighting on the British side in the War of 1812. He had no connection to the White Mountains, but misappropriation of Native American names was not uncommon in the 19th Century.


A view into Waterville Valley from the summit of Mt Tecumseh.



ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light AND head lamp, food / snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items, sun screen, bug repellent. Wear multiple layers of synthetic materials for warmth; trekking poles may be helpful gear for this hike.


RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:

TRAIL DESCRIPTIONS AND TRIP REPORTS
Link, Trail Description -- Mt. Tecumseh Trail
Link, Up-To-Date Trail Conditions


INFORMATION LINKS, MT. TECUMSEH
Link, SummitPost Page
Link, Hike The Whites Page
Link, New England 4,000 Peak-Bagging Page
Link, Appalachian Mountain Club Page
Link, Hike New England Page
Link, Wikipedia Page



NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN.

See you there! Julie.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
